lines.content: - Copilot was used in this increment in order to generate javadocs for my methods.
- This saved a lot of time as all I had to do was proofread the output and fix any minor mistakes.
# I would like to join this list. How can I help the project
For more information, please refer to our [contributor's guide](https://oss-generic.github.io/process/).
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/LeBron.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run LeBron.main()` (if the code
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the
What can I do for you?
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)

LeBron is your personal task management assistant with the mindset of a champion. Just like LeBron manages plays on the court, this chatbot helps you manage your daily tasks with focus and determination.
Add simple tasks without any deadlines.
LeBron will add the task to your lineup:
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks on the roster. Keep balling.
Add tasks that have a specific deadline you need to meet.
LeBron will add the deadline to your lineup:
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks on the roster. Keep balling.
Add events that span from a start date to an end date.
LeBron will add the event to your lineup:
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks on the roster. Keep balling.
View your complete lineup with all current tasks.
Here's the tasks on your roster:
Mark tasks as completed when you finish them.
Reset a task back to not done if you need to work on it again.
Got you — marked this as not done:
Remove tasks from your lineup when they're no longer needed.
LeBron clears the task from your lineup:
Now you have 2 tasks left. Stay focused.
You can also delete multiple tasks at once:
Search for tasks containing specific keywords.
Close LeBron when you're done planning.
Alright, I'm out. Keep grinding — see you soon, champ!
All dates should be entered in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., 2024-12-01).
Stay focused, keep grinding, and dominate your task list like a champion!
* Represents a command to add a task (ToDo, Deadline, or Event) to the task list.
* @param arguments The arguments provided with the add command.
* Determines the type of task to be added based on the command arguments.
* @return A string representing the task type.
public String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LeBronException {
* Creates a task based on the command arguments.
* @throws LeBronException If there is an error in task creation.
* @throws LeBronException If the description is empty.
* @throws LeBronException If there is an error in parsing the date or if the description is empty.
* @throws LeBronException If there is an error in parsing the dates or if any field is empty.
* Validates that a string is not empty.
* @param errorMessage The error message to throw if the string is empty.
* @throws LeBronException If the string is empty.
private void validateNotEmpty(String value, String errorMessage) throws LeBronException {
* Formats the success message after adding a task.
* @param task       The task that was added.
* @param totalTasks The total number of tasks in the list.
private String formatSuccessMessage(Task task, int totalTasks) {
* Represents a command that can be executed in the LeBron application.
* Each command performs a specific action on the task list, user interface, and storage.
* Returns true if this command signals the application to exit.
* Executes the command with the given task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param taskList The task list to operate on.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage for saving tasks.
* @return A string message to be displayed to the user after execution.
* @throws LeBronException If an error occurs during command execution.
public abstract String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LeBronException;
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.

* Parses and validates the task numbers from the command arguments.

* @param tasksToDelete The list of task indices that were deleted.
private String removeTaskMessage(TaskList taskList, ArrayList<Integer> tasksToDelete) throws LeBronException {

* When executed, it saves all tasks to storage and displays a goodbye message.
public String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LeBronException {

"Got it. Removed these tasks:\n" + "%s\nNow you have %d tasks left. Stay focused.%n";
